meanings.definition: A person who copies out documents, especially one employed to do this before printing was invented.
meanings.sent1: The scribe carefully copied the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent2: The scribe at the library transcribed the old book.
meanings.sent3: The scribe's job must have been tough without a printer!
meanings.sent4: She was a scribe, meticulously transferring the text like a human printer.
meanings.sent5: The scribe's role was crucial in preserving historical texts.

meanings.sent1: The scribe reported on the latest news in the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The scribe interviewed the famous actor for the magazine article.
meanings.sent3: The scribe's pen was mightier than the sword, they said.
meanings.sent4: She was a scribe of truth, uncovering scandals with her words.
meanings.sent5: The scribe's articles were always captivating and informative.

meanings.sent1: She will scribe the message on the stone tablet.
meanings.sent2: He scribed his name on the tree trunk with a knife.
meanings.sent3: The artist scribed a secret code on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The poet scribed his emotions onto the blank page.
meanings.sent5: The teacher scribed the lesson on the chalkboard for the class.
